item.title: Advertisers must take into account a world with multiple screens
item.description: A new study by global research firm TNS, titled “Connected Life,” reveals that television viewers are increasingly seeking out additional content while watching TV, leading to a surge in online content consumption and “screen-stacking.” This trend has significant ramifications for businesses aiming to optimize their advertising strategies. TNS discovered that nearly half of evening TV viewers (48%) engage in other digital activities simultaneously, such as using social media, checking emails, or online shopping.
